name: Jeffrey Pollard
text: Road was suitable for ATV or horseback. I thought it was abandoned. A beautiful spot in the heart of Alabama, if given maintenance and TLC.

name: Steven Breckenridge
text: Just beautiful to stand on top of the mountain and look out across the land.  The host is just awesome, with a ton of knowledge, great stories about his hiking trips.  Unbelievable spot to visit, we were on a back road/dirt road trip from Jacksonville FL to Barber Motorsports Park on Enduro motorcycles

name: Ghost Tracker Jenny
text: Went tracking through the woods, at night, barely any light with my paranormal team to find a church. Didn't find the church, but got loads of activity. Just be cautious of the cemetery as some graves are not marked and are caving in.

name: Carl Steele
text: Overlooks the entire expanse of Huntsville. In the autumn months, the golden shades of red, yellow, brown, and orange paint a canvas that can only be truly appreciated in person. Indeed, it is a wonder!

name: Kathleen Bussey
text:
😱BEAUTIFUL!,Just.Simply BEAUTIFUL!
I'm from Florida,and you don't see these kind of sights!
And hiking trails are spectacular, on the particular day we went there was quite heavy fog just about everywhere!
And they have little county store there where you can get snacks & juice/soda
Oh Yhea, and there are cabins you can rent for a day or week, stay as long as you want to??        NO, idk how long you can stay? I wish I lived up there😢
But we had a MORE than GREAT DAY!

name: T L C
text: I love the hiking trails and especially the scenery of Huntsville from this mountain.

name: Kelly Oldfield
text: Love to go to this place. Love the view from the top of the mountain overlooking the city of Huntsville below.

name: Brian Presson
text: It has some of the best public trails for hiking and mountain biking, with a spectacular view overlooking the downtown Huntsville scenery. I have hiked there several times before, and I plan to do so more in the near future.

name: Robert Stahl
text: On a beatiful spring day I arrived Monte Sano park. ($5/person) At the visitor center, on the the top of the north plateau, I got a map of the main hiking trails. I chose an easy 1.2 mile loop trail around the the top edges of the North Plateau. It had several outstanding senic overlooks to the surrounding mountains and valleys. Trail was well marked. Started at 1600 feet, dropped to 1500, and climbed back up to 1600, fairly flat but 100 ft elevation change. Did not hurry. Stopped from time to time to take vista photos. Noteable waterfall, with opportunity to climb down it a bit. Arrived back to starting place parking lot in 70 minutes. Excellent experience and great photos. No mosquitos, no ticks.

name: Robert Klineyoung
text: Many good memories

name: Cindy Coffey
text: Loved everything bout it!

name: James E Doty (Bud)
text: All I can say is I take the road to Hog Mountain to get to my brothers house.
